bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench and Mary Hench to Blossom Reed, July 23, 1950

div1.p: The Henches send condolences to Blossom Reed on the death of her mother, and assure her that the Walter Reed Memorial Association will continue paying Emilie Lawrence Reed's subsidy to Blossom.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench and Mary Hench to Blossom Reed, July 23, 1950
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
1206
Send the following message, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
MISS BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT PA
div1.p:
WE SEND LOVING SALUTE TO YOUR MOTHERS MEMORY AND OUR AFFECTIONATE
REGARDS TO THAT GRACIOUS LADYS DAUGHTER WHO WAS UTTERLY FAITHFUL
UNTIL DEATH. ARLINGTON CEREMONY WILL BEAUTIFULLY SYMBOLIZE REUNION OF
YOUR DISTINGUSHED PARENTS. WILL BE PRESENT WITH YOU IN HEART AND
MIND. REST ASSURED WALTER REED MEMORIAL ASSOCIATION PLANS TO CONTINUE
YOUR MOTHERS SUBSIDY FOR YOU
div1.closer: PHILIP AND MARY HENCH COPY OF NL SENT JULY 23RD
